rules and regulations generally no person with oil on the body shall be allowed to enter the pool until the same is removed no crowding on diving boards shall be permitted all profane and indecent language is prohibited in the pool and in the dressing rooms all persons are prohibited from walking on edge of pool or on scum gutter from running around the pool and from spitting in the pool the throwing of paper confetti or trash of any kind into the pool is also prohibited    persons suffering from disease etc prohibited no person suffering from any disease sore or wound of any kind shall be admitted to the pool    shower and foot bath required all persons desiring to use the pool must first have a shower bath and use the foot bath required by the city before entering the pool    smoking prohibited a the possession of lighted smoking materials in any form including but not limited to the possession of lighted cigarettes cigars pipes or other tobacco products is prohibited in on or about the north kansas city swimming pool facility or on the surrounding swimming pool premises b the director of public works of the city shall prominently post no smoking signs with letters not less than one inch in height or the international no smoking symbol consisting of pictorial representation of a burning cigarette enclosed in a red circle with a bar across it at various locations at the swimming pool facility in the city and on the swimming pool premises surrounding the pool c any person who shall violate any of the provisions of this section is deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction shall be punished pursuant to the provisions of  street trees and park trees definitions park trees are defined as trees shrubs bushes and all other woody vegetation having individual names  and parks are defined as all areas owned by the city or to which the public has free access as a park street trees are defined as trees shrubs bushes and all other woody vegetation on land lying between property lines on either side of all streets avenues or ways within the city    creation and establishment of a city tree board there is established a city tree board for the city which shall consist of the director of public works superintendent of buildings and grounds and the director of parks and recreation of this city    duties and responsibilities it shall be the responsibility of the board to study investigate counsel and develop andor update annually and administer a written plan for the care preservation pruning planting replanting removal or disposition of trees and shrubs in parks along streets and in other public areas such plan will be presented annually to the city council and upon their acceptance and approval shall constitute the official comprehensive city tree plan for the city the board when requested by the city council shall consider investigate make findings report and recommend upon any special matter or question coming within the scope of its work    operation the board shall choose its own officers make its own rules and regulations and keep a journal of its proceedings a majority of the members shall be a quorum for the transaction of business    tree species to be planted the tree board shall maintain the official list of recommended trees for planting in public areas the purpose of this listing will be to maintain the diversity in the total tree population this list shall be available upon request to aid in the selection of trees for private and public properties the list of recommended trees may be updated periodically by the tree board to reflect new developments or species that will affect the population of the community forest no species other than those included in this list may be without written permission of the tree board    spacing the spacing of street trees will be in accordance with the three species size classes listed in the official list of recommended trees and no trees may be planted closer together than the following small trees thirty 30 feet  medium trees forty 40 feet  and large trees fifty 50 feet  except in special plantings designed or approved by a landscape architect    distance from curb and sidewalk the distance trees may be planted from curbs or curblines and sidewalks will be in accordance with the three species size classes listed in the official list of recommended trees and no trees may be planted closer to any curb or sidewalk than the following small trees two feet  medium trees three feet  and large trees four feet    distance from street corners and fireplugs no street tree shall be planted closer than thirtyfive 35 feet of any street corner measured from the point of nearest intersecting curbs or curblines no street tree shall be planted closer than ten 10 feet of any fireplug    utilities no street trees other than those species listed as small trees on the official list of recommended trees may be planted under or within ten 10 lateral feet of any overhead utility wire or over or within five lateral feet of any underground water line sewer line transmission line or other utility    public tree care a the city shall have the right to plant prune maintain and remove trees plants and shrubs within the lines of all streets alleys avenues lanes squares and public grounds as may be necessary to insure public safety or to preserve or enhance the symmetry and beauty of such public grounds b the city tree board may remove or cause or order to be removed any tree or part thereof which is in an unsafe condition or which by reason of its nature is injurious to sewers electric power lines gas lines water lines or other public improvements or is affected with any injurious fungus insect or other pest c any utility with overhead facilities must have on file a set of tree trimming standards utilities will be allowed to trim trees and shrubbery upon and overhanging streets and other public property so as to prevent the branches and foliage from coming in contact with the wires cables and other facilities of the utility based upon the preapproved set of standards care will be exercised to prevent unnecessary trimming so as to protect any aesthetic benefits of the presence of certain trees and shrubbery d this section does not prohibit the planting of street trees by adjacent property owners providing that the selection and location of said trees is in accordance with     tree topping it is unlawful as a normal practice for any person firm or city department to top any street tree park tree or other tree on public property topping is defined as the severe cutting back of limbs to stubs larger than three inches in diameter within the trees crown to such a degree so as to remove the normal canopy and disfigure the tree trees severely damaged by storms or other causes or certain trees under utility wires or other obstructions where other pruning practices are impractical may be exempted from this section at the determination of the city tree board    pruning corner clearance every owner of any tree overhanging any street or rightofway within the city shall prune the branches so that such branches shall not obstruct the light from any street lamp or obstruct the view of any street intersection and so that there shall be a clear space of eight feet above the surface of the street or sidewalk owners shall remove all dead diseased or dangerous trees or broken or decayed limbs which constitute a menace to the safety of the public the city shall have the right to prune any tree or shrub on private property when it interferes with the proper spread of light along the street from a street light or interferes with visibility of any trafficcontrol device or sign    dead or diseased tree removal on private property the city shall have the right to cause the removal of any dead or diseased trees on private property within the city when such trees constitute a hazard to life and property or harbor insects or disease which constitute a potential threat to other trees within the city the city tree board will notify in writing the owners of such trees removal shall be done by such owners at their own expense within sixty 60 days after the date of service of notice in the event of failure of owners to comply with such provisions the city shall have the authority to remove such trees and charge the cost of removal on the owners property tax notice    removal of stumps all stumps of street and park trees shall be removed below the surface of the ground so that the top of the stump shall not project above the surface of the ground    interference with city tree board it is unlawful for any person to prevent delay or interfere with the city tree board or any of its agents while engaging in and about the planting cultivating mulching pruning spraying or removing of any street trees park trees or trees on private grounds as authorized in this chapter    authorization for work and bond a it is unlawful for any person or firm to engage in the business or occupation of pruning treating or removing street trees within the city without first receiving authorization from the director of public works or his or her designee b it is unlawful for any person or firm to engage in the business or occupation of pruning treating or removing park trees within the city without first receiving authorization from the director of parks and recreation or his or her designee c each person shall first file evidence of possession of liability insurance in the minimum amounts of one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 for bodily injury and one hundred thousand dollars $10000000 property damage indemnifying the city or any person injured or damaged resulting from the pursuit of such endeavors as herein described    review by city council the city council shall have the right to review the conduct acts and decisions of the city tree board any person may appeal from any ruling or order of the city tree board to the city council who may hear the matter and make a final decision    penalty any person found guilty of violating disobeying omitting neglecting or refusing to comply with any of the provisions of this chapter shall be fined in accordance with this code for each offense a separate and distinct offense shall be deemed committed each day on which a violation occurs or continues  title 13  public services chapters water service system definitions unless the context specifically indicates otherwise the following terms shall for the purpose of this chapter have the meanings indicated in this section customer means a firm corporation legal entity or governmental unit furnished water by the department department means the city of north kansas city public works department division means the water division of the public works department inspection means an investigation and review by the water division of work performed by others under a permit issued by the public works department lead based materials when used with respect to solder and flux means solders and flux containing more than 02 percent lead  when used with respect to pipes and pipe fittings means pipes and pipe fittings containing more than eight percent lead master meter means one meter measuring the water furnished to serve two or more premises meter means a mechanical device that measures and records the quantity of water furnished to a customer meter setting means a box vault or tile with covering containing a meter meter yoke and connecting appurtenances permit means a written document issued by the public works department authorizing work to be performed public drinking water system means any publicly or privately owned water system supplying water to the general public which is satisfactory for drinking culinary and domestic purposes and meets the requirements of the missouri department of natural resources water main means the water pipe fittings valves boxes and manholes installed as an integral part of the distribution system but not including hydrant units and water service piping water service means the piping installed from the water main to that portion of the interior piping regulated by the building code  part 2004   permits a applications for water service shall be made at city hall by or on behalf of the customer requesting water service the application shall be in such form as shall be prescribed by the department every customer using water from the waterworks system shall be deemed to have consented and agreed to the terms and provisions of this chapter b permits are of three kinds defined as follows 1 service permits are required where taps are to be made and new services are to be installed  2 extension permits are required where an existing service whether on public or private property is to be altered extended repaired or renewed from the main to the building or fixtures or appurtenances added thereto or detached from and when service is disconnected and abandoned at the mains  3 renewal permits are required where an existing service or services are to be abandoned and replaced with a single larger service that requires a larger tap or the relocation of any existing service that requires a new tap c no work in connection with the tappings of any main or the introduction of water into any premises public or private shall be done nor shall any water service be altered repaired or extended without prior issuance of a permit authorizing the performance of such work when the plumber must perform emergency work during other than normal working hours the water division shall be notified by telephone prior to the starting of such work and the plumber shall secure the permit on the next regular working day see c for inspection to be performed during other than normal working hours d a master plumbers or journeyman plumbers license is not transferable any master plumber shall subject himself or herself to suspension if he or she attempts to or procures a water permit for the benefit of anyone other than himself or herself e permits are not transferable and are only valid for the applicant to whom issued and for the job described thereon f permits are valid for ninety 90 consecutive days from the date of issuance if the permit expires before the completion of the project it must be renewed request for renewal must be made to the city public works department either by telephone in writing or in person reasons for such renewal and a report of the work to date shall accompany each request an extension of time for an additional thirty 30 days will be granted in all proper cases and noted on the permit there will be no charge for renewal  however all outstanding permits that have exceeded the time limit and are not properly renewed will be classified as delinquent g all permit fees and charges shall be paid by the applicant at the time of procuring the permit 1 permit fees shall not be refundable  2 all charges shall be in accordance with the schedules of prices specified herein in the event that the permit is not used these charges shall be refunded h no permits will be issued to anyone who is delinquent in payments for water services i permits shall be issued by the public works department to qualified applicants only after all requirements are satisfied a permit for fire protection service will not be issued without evidence of a water service line for domestic use permits are issued subject to a city water main being in front of the property to be served if the property is large enough to permit a subdividing at a later date it will be necessary for the water main to front the subdivided property on which the facility to be served is constructed failure of the applicant to pay a bill for service rendered by the water division shall be a basis for denial of further permits until such bill or bills be paid persistent violation of this provision may be considered cause for revoking the master plumbers license held by the offender j applicants shall be prepared to show proof of qualification at the time of application and shall procure permits for themselves and no other permits shall be issued only to the following 1 a plumber who may apply as an individual firm partnership or corporation  2 licensed automatic sprinkler system contractors who are to install fire protection systems only as described in the building code  3 other utilities or municipalities that purchase water from the city  4 contractors who are performing work under city contract which requires them to modify existing water facilities may be issued permits for the work defined in the contract k prior to receiving the permit the applicant must submit the following documents for examination at the permit desk 1 notification from the city that all fees have been paid  2 where excavation on public property is necessary the applicant must exhibit an excavation permit issued by the public works department city hall l each application for a permit shall be made in writing and shall be signed by the applicant as defined in j or his or her duly authorized agent the application shall state in precise terms the work to be done under the permit in addition each application shall contain the following information 1 the name of the person for whom the work is to be performed or the owner of the property served  2 the correct address and other legal description where work is to be performed house numbers must be assigned by the public works department m each permit must be returned to the public works department permit desk by the person to whom it is issued within fortyeight 48 hours after the authorized work has been completed and within ninety 90 days from the date of issuance of such permit returned permits must contain a complete report of all work done and such a report shall be of form and content as prescribed on the permit n reports must be signed by the applicant each report must state the date on which the work was completed and must be accompanied by a certificate of inspection signed by the inspector for service lines connected to the citys water mains and serving premises outside the city limits an inspection slip must be provided by the plumbing inspection section of the buildings inspection division certifying that no cross connections are present in the plumbing system of the building served o a permit which fails to show clearly and accurately all of the required information shall be rejected and the applicant shall make corrections immediately permits returned without a certificate of inspection signed by the inspector will be rejected laxity in making reports or corrections shall be cause for classifying permits as delinquent p a plumber or sprinkler system contractor shall be responsible for any defective workmanship performed or material furnished on public property for a period of one year from the date of final inspection by the water division of the public works department q the public works department shall be authorized to cancel for any cause any permit issued  part 2004   water mains a water mains are classified functionally as feeder mains distribution mains and service mains a further classification into city mains and private mains is also made these mains are further described as follows 1 a feeder main is a water conduit that is used for transportation of water from one part of the water system to a more remote part or reservoir and coming from pump stations these mains are usually sixteen 16 inches in diameter and smaller  2 a distribution main is a water conduit that is connected between and from feeder mains and is the principal means of supply for localities these mains are usually eight to twelve 12 inches in diameter and no less than eight inches in diameter for all pipe laid after   3 a service main is a conduit that supplies water directly to a customer service connection these shall be mains smaller than twelve 12 inches in diameter twelve 12 inch mains may be classed either service mains or distribution mains as deemed appropriate by the water division of the public works department b private water mains will not be allowed connection to the citys system except as a provision between the water division and applicant those private mains presently connected to the water division system and in contract with water division mains shall be subject to the regulations hereinafter set forth c connections to water mains shall be made as provided in these rules and regulations the owner of private water mains where that owner is not a public utility must allow new customers to make a service connection to or extend from it for their own purposes the owner is permitted to charge a fee for this connection and in the event of disagreement as to the amount of the fee the public works department shall act as arbiter and will fix a price that will be binding on both parties all applications for permits to connect to a private water main must be accompanied by a letter from the owner which states specifically that the owner approves the connection d when a new water division main is laid paralleling an obsolete existing main connection between the water divisions new main and existing individual tap services will be made at the citys expense and the obsolete main will be abandoned where such obsolete main is a private main the cost of transferring services will be charged as ordered by the public works department e operation of mains shall be performed only by the water division personnel requests by the plumbers for the shutting down of mains shall be made a reasonable time in advance and shutdown will be performed during regular working hours unless request stipulates otherwise when shutdowns are made for the benefit of the person making the request he or she will be charged for this service on the basis of prevailing labor and equipment rates f the responsibility for maintenance of mains shall be with the owner of the main in event of failure of a private main where such failure constitutes a menace to public health and safety or excessive loss of water the water division of the public works department will repair the main and the owner shall bear the cost otherwise the owner will be notified and he or she may elect to have either the water division or his or her contractor repair the main at his or her own expense g all service mains serving residential homes single dwelling will be maintained as stated a service line from distribution main to meter pit including lid cover meter yoke ell valve meter pit service line tap piping and fittings will be maintained serviced repaired replaced removed and relocated at the sole expense of the water division of the public works department all other piping fitting and valves will be the responsibility of the property owner from the house side of the meter pit to the house h all service mains serving commercial factory or industrial areas shall be maintained repaired and replaced removed resized and kept up to the divisions standards at all times by the property owner or building owner service mains serving commercial factory or industrial services are as follows 1 everything connected from distribution mains including corporation cocks or sleeves valves piping meter meter pits meter settings and bypass lines and piping in meter pits and entire service into the building or property  2 the water division of the public works department will at no time be held responsible to maintain commercial factory or industrial service main except as stated in f  3 the water division of the public works department reserves the right to do the work or reject the work upon the request of such work the public works department will act as arbiter in cases of question as to what is termed residential commercial factory and industrial  part 2004   water services a water service piping is classified into two categories tap service piping and branch service piping the components of tap service piping are a corporation stop copper pipe a curb stop and box meter yoke and meter stop valve the components of a branch service piping are a tapping sleeve and valve a valve box pipe meter stop valves and bypass piping branch service piping may be for domestic water service or private fire protection service when branch service piping is used for private fire protection the service size must be designed by an engineer it may not be tapped for domestic service unless otherwise approved by the water division b all service lines shall conform to the following requirements 1 service connections are to be made in front of the property to be served unless otherwise approved by the water division  2 service lines are to be run perpendicular to the main from the main to the curb box or in the absence of a curb box to the property line  3 service lines shall be laid at least ten feet horizontally from any existing or proposed drain or sewer line should local conditions prevent a lateral separation of ten 10 feet a water service line may be laid closer than ten 10 feet to a storm or sanitary sewer line provided that the service line is laid in a separate trench or on an undisturbed earth shelf located on one side of the sewer line and at such an elevation that the bottom of the service line is at least eighteen 18 inches above the top of the sewer line when it is impossible to obtain vertical or horizontal separation the sewer line must be relaid and constructed with ductile iron or copper with flare or mechanical compression fittings and shall be pressuretested to assure water tightness before backfilling unless otherwise approved by the water division  4 where service lines must cross over sewers storm drains or sanitary sewers the service line must be laid at such an elevation that the bottom of the service line is at least eighteen 18 inches above the top of the sewer this vertical separation must be maintained for that portion of the service line located within ten 10 feet horizontally of any sewer or sewer line that it crosses said ten 10 feet to be measured as the normal distance from the service line to the sewer unless otherwise approved by the water division  5 service lines shall have a cover of not less than four feet nor more than five feet unless obstructions require deeper excavation for clearance  6 no service line shall be less than threequarter inches in diameter  7 a backflow preventor valve is required on all irrigation systems or other lines constituting a cross connection to the public water supply in buildings already built and not disconnected cross connections are not allowed in any building being built or repaired and must be removed and building piping worked to specifications see  c all tap service lines shall conform to the following requirements 1 all tap service piping shall conform to the latest american public works association apwa specifications for type k flexible copper tubing or to the latest american water works association awwa specification c901 for highdensity polyethylene hdpe hdpe service lines shall be a minimum of sidr9 with a pressure rating of one hundred sixty 160 psi 2 the connection of the tap service line to the corporation shall be by means of a flared fitting or approved compression fitting  3 the line shall be laid with an expansion loop located as near to the corporation stop as possible this loop shall be in the form of a half s bend and be at least six inches of the centerline of the run  4 no union shall be permitted between the corporation stop and the meter pit and meter pit to house or building where the distance is less than one hundred 100 feet where distance is greater than one hundred 100 feet flared unions or approved compression fittings only shall be used  5 no sweat joints will be permitted on any portion of the service line  6 each curb stop must be fitted with a curb box curb boxes shall be cast iron metal material five and onequarter inch when in street or parking lot or roadway and shall be made in two sections that will permit an adjustment of not less than one foot in length so that the overall length can be varied from four to five feet the lower section of the box shall have a minimum internal diameter of six inches  7 where meters are set indoors the service line must enter the building not higher than four feet to center above the floor on which the meter is set  8 each tap service line shall fitted with a stop valve immediately on entering a building where the meter is already indoors an existing building this valve may be part of the meter set the stop valve shall be in accordance with current water division specifications  9 threequarter inch and one inch k copper services do not require curb stop at the water supply main threequarter inch and one inch services will have two meter valves in meter pit for commercial and factory existing meters located inside buildings may remain so until such a time that they are preferred outside by the building owner the building is altered or changed or major repair work is to be done on building or service at this time the meter will be moved outside or service will be discontinued until specifications set forth in this chapter are met  10 all services two inches and smaller shall be k copper or hdpe hdpe service lines shall be colored blue and shall use #12 awg copperhead reinforced trace wire blue in color stiffeners shall be used in the ends of the hdpe all services greater than two inches shall be ductile pipe class 52 or better d all branch services shall conform to the following requirements 1 branch services two inches and smaller in diameter shall conform to the latest apwa specifications for type k flexible copper tubing branch service lines larger than two inches shall be cement lined ductile iron class 52 or better and conform to the water division standards and specifications for water main extensions only flared or approved compression connections shall be permitted on copper branch service lines and soil flux or silver soldier to be used only in meter pits unless otherwise approved by the water division  2 branch service lines shall be connected to the main with a tapping sleeve and valve or a tee and gate valve valves shall turn counter clockwise or left to open and shall be in accordance with apwa specifications  3 the tapping valve or gate valve on branch service connections shall be fitted with a valve box that conforms to apwa specifications valve boxes shall also be fitted with a five and onequarter inch valve box base where necessary  4 all branch service lines shall be fitted with a stop valve immediately on entering a building e a service line to supply domestic water may be connected to a branch service line used for fire protection only under the following conditions if approved by the public works department 1 connection shall be made in a location having the prior approval of the water division  2 service line for domestic water shall be considered either tap service piping or branch service piping and shall be subject to the provisions of b c or d whichever governs  3 the combination service lines shall be installed as specified by the water division 4 domestic service lines must have a backflow preventer or check valve in line according to north kansas city backflow ordinance and be valved before and after all connection fittings according to apwa specifications f temporary service will be permitted only by written request to the public works department and subject to their approval 1 a permit is required for temporary service and is valid for thirty 30 days only and to be kept in force must be renewed at the end of each thirty 30 day period  2 disconnection and abandonment of temporary services shall be in accordance with the rules herein set forth g when a service pipe is installed for future use the pipe shall be installed as far as the curb stop and the curb stop plugged an extension permit will be required to complete the service h a multiple domestic service is a service having one connection to the main and branching on public property before entrance to a single building multiple domestic service piping must meet the following requirements 1 the single building to be served shall be either a store room a duplex an apartment or separately leased property  2 each shall require a permit  3 each branch shall have a separate curb stop  4 distances between branch services shall be a minimum of five feet  5 each branch shall have a separate meter  i the water division shall maintain residential service lines from the main to and including the meters the owner shall maintain the service line after the house side of the meter and assure a safe potable water supply and in a structural condition that will permit water division employees to perform normally assigned duties maintenance of meter tiles pits and service lines in residential areas shall be in accordance with apwa specifications repairs to any section of the service line shall be performed in an approved manner using approved materials an insulating bushing shall be used when a new copper service line is connected to an existing service line other than copper j service lines must be disconnected at the main in the event of building demolition or alteration abandonment of services shall be performed under an extension permit in the following manner 1 on tap service connections the corporation stop shall be uncovered the corporation stop turned off the service line disconnected and corporation stop capped off two feet of the service line must be cut off all curb boxes and meter tiles whether on public or private property shall have all rings covers and lids removed wall casings removed or broken down to a minimum of one foot below grade and backfilled to grade  2 on branch service connections the abandonment shall be performed in a manner specified by the water division k when a building is to be razed or moved all unnecessary services to the premises shall be abandoned in accordance with the following 1 a master plumber shall procure an extension permit for each service to be abandoned and shall perform all work necessary to abandon tap services  2 the master plumber shall be responsible for the excavating and backfilling of all holes and repair of street cuts  3 on tap services the master plumber shall perform the work of disconnecting line from corporation cock and plug and cut two feet off line abandonment of the curb box and of meter tile and lid inspection shall be made before backfilling  4 when branch services are to be abandoned the master plumber will be informed at the time of application for permit the manner in which the service is to be abandoned and the disposition of the meter pit if the water division chooses to salvage the tapping valve the operation of mains and the disconnecting and plugging shall be performed by the water division at its own expense and the plumber shall perform all other work the same as in abandonment of tap service l when a building is to be altered any service abandonment shall be the same as the abandonment for building demolition and all provisions stated herein are applied all meters at this time will be moved outside with a new meter setting and pit m when a plumber is required to repair services that have been disconnected or turned off at the corporation stop by the water division he or she shall apply for and obtain an extension permit a new service line renewal permit and tap will be required street repair is the responsibility of the plumber n relocation and replacement of water service lines between the main and the meter tile shall be in accordance with these regulations residential commercial factory and industrial are used when it apples the water division reserves the right to specify or determine one from the other when repairs removals replacements relocations of service valves meter pits piping and fitting when and where it applies  part 2004  1142014   service taps a taps are classified as corporation taps or branch taps 1 a corporation tap is the cutting of threads directly on the wall of the water main and the insertion of a corporation stop  2 a branch tap is a connection to the main made by employing a tapping valve and sleeve or saddle a tee and valve shall also be considered a branch service tap b all taps shall be subject to the following requirements 1 tapping shall be performed only by the water division  2 taps shall be located within the property lines of the property to be served unless otherwise approved by the water division  3 taps shall be made on the side of the main nearest the premises to be served  4 responsibility for excavation protection of excavation and backfilling shall rest on the master plumber named in the permit  5 excavations must be free of water and debris so that the tapper and inspector can perform their tasks without delay should the work be in such a condition as to necessitate an additional trip by the tapper or inspector the master plumber shall be charged for such additional trips at the prevailing rate all tap holes over four feet deep must be shored or trench jack to hold sides of trench up safety rules and regulations will be observed and maintained at all times c corporation taps shall be subject to the following requirements and made only by the water division personnel 1 no corporation tap shall be larger than one inch in diameter  2 corporation taps shall be made so that the corporation stop is inserted at approximately fortyfive 45 degrees on the top quadrant of the main  3 if corporation taps cannot be made in accordance with subsection c2 of this section because of obstructions or conditions that cannot be changed the water division will determine how the tap is to be done  4 noncorrosive tapping saddles will be used on all one and onehalfinch services and twoinch services and run in k copper with flare fittings or approved compression fittings or hdpe dr9 cts blue stiffeners must be used in the ends of hdpe with #12 awg copperhead reinforced trace wire blue in color  5 a corporation tap shall not be closer than three feet to a bell spigot valve or blow off  6 excavation shall be a minimum four feet by four feet at the surface and shall be four feet by four feet at the main the main must be entirely uncovered tunneling to provide access for tap is not acceptable in most cases d branch taps shall be subject to the following requirements 1 on all service piping larger than two inches a branch tap shall be made  2 branch taps shall be made so that the tapping valve is horizontal to insure a vertical valve box over the tapping valve  3 branch taps shall not be made closer than eighteen 18 inches from the bell end of the pipe or three feet from the spigot end the minimum distance between taps from face to face of sleeve shall be six feet  4 the excavation for a branch tap shall extend seven feet from the face of the main and the main shall have eighteen 18 inches of clearance all around and tap holes or trench must be five feet wide safety rules will apply here as in general requirements for taps  5 all branches taps four inches and larger shall be provided with backing blocks or otherwise restrained in a manner approved by the water division  6 the tapping valve on each branch tap shall be provided with a hardwood block support at least ten 10 inches square and two inches thick placed on a center line with the valve stem supporting blocks are to have good bearing on undisturbed soil the cost of repairing failures of tapping sleeves and valves found without supporting blocks shall be charged to the plumber under whose permit the subject work was done e the plumber shall notify the water division in sufficient time to schedule his or her tap when taps are desired before noon the request must be received before ten am two days prior to tap when taps are desired in the afternoon the request must be received before twelve noon two days prior to tap f tapping charges shall be in accordance with the price schedule specified in b8 of this chapter  part 2004  1142014   meter sets a meter sets are classified by location into two categories  indoor meter sets that are already inside an existing building and meter sets to buildings that are being built or will be built in the future b all meter sets shall conform to the following requirements 1 all meters shall be in an approved nonhazardous place and accessibility shall be maintained at all times  2 all meters shall be set in a horizontal position  3 the size of a meter shall never be larger than the service line in which it is installed  4 all meter sets for meters one and onehalf inches and larger will require a sealed bypass valve oraseal or equal  5 meter sets for meters one and onehalf inches and larger will require brass flanges on both sides of meter brass flanges shall be in accordance with water division specifications  6 the master plumber shall furnish and install all pipe fittings and valves necessary for the meter set in accordance with the appropriate specifications of the water division c in existing buildings all indoor meter sets for meters less than one and onehalf inches shall conform to the following requirements unless otherwise approved by the water division 1 no meter set shall be permitted left inside a building unless a floor drain is provided within twenty 20 feet of the meter  2 meters shall not be set higher than four feet to the center of connection above the floor  3 meters shall not be installed in recreation rooms rest rooms or utility rooms nor be concealed and obstructed by items cabinets benches or other builtin fixtures  4 indoor meter sets shall be made as near as possible to the point where the service line enters the building  5 an indoor meter set for meters threequarters inch shall be installed with a meter yoke as required by the water division  6 meters shall not be reinstalled in a place of business without the written permission of the water division the procedure for requesting permission is stated herein under g d in existing buildings meters one and onehalf inches and larger shall conform to the following requirements and conditions 1 where large meters are indoors written permission must be obtained from the water division procedure for requesting permission is stated herein under c and g will apply here also  2 a lifting ring or hook to accommodate a hoist shall be firmly affixed to the building by casting in concrete or welding to steel this device shall be installed directly over the meter this is applicable to meters weighting over sixty 60 pounds  3 a clear access way to the meter shall be maintained at all times the access way shall be large enough to accommodate an industrial truck  4 where the meter set is on a lower floor an elevator or hoist well shall be available to permit transportation of the meter to the street level without negotiating a stairway this is applicable to meters weighing over sixty 60 pounds  5 the building must be equipped with a loading dock or driveway and water division vehicles shall be permitted access to these areas  6 meter set shall be made in such a locality that reading and changing of meter shall in no way interfere with the customers normal course of business  7 customers shall furnish and allow the use of lifting tackle and industrial trucks for the changing and transporting of meters on the premises motorized equipment furnished by the customer shall be operated only by the customers employees  8 meter sets valves and piping shall be made for pit installations or as proposed by the applicant and approved by the water division e all outdoor meter sets for meters one inch and smaller shall conform to the following requirements 1 when meters are placed on private property written permission must be obtained from the water division procedure for requesting permission is stated herein under g  2 when outdoor meters are placed on private property they must be in a location near a driveway or turnout and be accessible to water division vehicles location of meter shall be such that water division personnel cannot damage lawns shrubs or other property nor interfere with the consumers normal course of business nor be a hazard to consumers and departments personnel  3 meters shall be in an approved pit and in the arrangement as specified by the city water division  4 maintenance and testing of meters will be performed by the water division all meter tiles and pits are the property of the owner and shall be maintained by same f all outdoor meter sets for meters one and onehalf inches and larger shall conform to the following requirements 1 meter sets may be placed on public or private property  2 when meters are placed on private property written permission must be obtained from the public works department procedure for requesting permission is stated herein under g  3 when outdoor meters are placed on private property they must be in a location near a driveway or turnout and be accessible to water division vehicles location of meter under a public works department permit b the entire work as described on each permit shall be subject to inspection if the work is to be performed in phases an inspection shall be required for each phase c inspections will be performed during normal working hours when it is required that inspections be performed at times other than normal working hours the plumber making the request will be charged for the direct cost of such inspection d plumbers shall make request for inspections to the public works department request for inspections will be disregarded and the inspection not made if a permit for the work has not been issued e service line excavations and trenches presented for inspection shall be free of water debris earth and other matter that would hinder the inspector service lines shall be inspected under line pressure during the inspection 1 where a copper service line is laid in a trench the trench shall be left open for its entire length and the entire length of service line exposed to view  2 where a cast iron service line is installed in a trench it may be backfilled before inspection except that all joints and fittings shall not be backfilled but left exposed  3 where a service line is bored the excavations required for boring shall be left open and the portion of service line in these excavations shall be exposed to view f fire protection and domestic services four inches and larger must be hydrostatically tested in accordance with apwa specifications all inspections of this type shall be by prior approval and arrangement by the water division all extraordinary expenses for this inspection and test shall be borne by the applicant requesting same  part 2004   damage to the water system a plumbers engaged in repairing services are cautioned to exercise care to that portion of the service over which the water division has jurisdiction as herein set forth whenever the aforementioned section of the water service lines is damaged by a plumber so that it is necessary for the water division to make repairs the plumber shall be held liable for the cost of such repair and permits shall be denied to him or her until such costs are paid the plumber shall be held responsible under the following circumstances 1 on all main to curb service lines where it can be shown that the damage is caused by carelessness neglect improper use of tools or any practice not in accordance with the standards of the trades or any practice in violation of public works department regulations  2 on all copper main to curb service lines if damage is caused by carelessness or neglect in the opinion of the water division  3 on all main to curb service lines where the water division employees must work on an overtime basis to repair the line b those plumbers who have a consistent record of breakage shall be deemed careless and therefore made subject to the aforementioned penalties c whenever a main to curb service becomes broken or damaged to the extent that it needs repair the plumber is instructed to call the water division and inform the water division of this need the plumber should clearly state that repairs can be performed during normal working hours or that they must be performed on an overtime basis  part 2004   relocation of water facilities factory and commerce requiring relocation of water service lines curb boxes meter tiles or required relocated at the property owners expense and that portion from the existing meter pit to the building shall be relocated by the plumber under contract for same or by owner b if the service line is copper from the main to the meter pit the property owner will if required relocate this portion at its own expense  the galvanized portion from the meter pit to house shall be replaced and relocated by the plumber under contract or by owner all galvanized piping whether on public or private property requiring relocation shall be replaced with copper in accordance with these regulations c on service lines that are galvanized from the main to the building and require relocation the property owner at its expense will relocate and replace that portion of the service line from the main to the proposed relocation of the building meter pit on service lines that have meter pits the property owner will renew service to meter pits piping on the building side of the meter pit requiring relocation shall be relocated and replaced with copper by the plumber under contract for same or by owner  d all residential meter pits shall be relocated on public property if possible meter pits for   private service line leaks a water leaks in private water service lines are declared to be a public nuisance that must be repaired according to the terms of this section it is unlawful for any water customer andor occupant of private property to fail to repair a service line leak upon proper notice to do so b upon discovery of a leak in a private water service line the public works department shall serve a notice to repair the leak within seven days of the date on the notice such notice shall be served upon the water customer or occupant personally or by registered mail failure to repair the leak within seven days as directed will result in the disconnection of water service service shall not be reconnected until the leak is repaired and a disconnectreconnect fee has been paid c the public works department has the right to disconnect water service without notice if a leak has been discovered d if the water is flowing beyond the private property line in such a way that hazard to public safety exists or a water emergency has been declared a notice of disconnection shall be left at the property in addition a notice of repair shall be given service shall not be reconnected until the leak has been repaired however no disconnectreconnect fee will be charged for disconnection pursuant to this subsection e failure to repair a water leak in a private water service line as required herein shall not be a criminal violation of the city code  part 2004   when water service may be shut off without notice water service may be shut off to any consumer by the public works department the terms of this chapter or any other applicable ordinances of the city or of the statutes of the state  part 2004   city not liable for necessary interruptions of service in instances where the commercial and industrial waste division 1  general provisions   purpose and policy a this article sets forth requirements for discharge of commercial and industrial wastes to the sewer system of the city the objectives of this article are 1 to prevent the introduction of pollutants into the sewer system that will interfere with the operation of the sewer system or wastewater treatment facilities or damage the infrastructure or equipment  2 to prevent the introduction of pollutants into the sewer system which will pass citys wastewater treatment facilities into receiving waters without adequate treatment or otherwise be incompatible with the sewer system and treatment works  3 to ensure that the quality of the citys wastewater sludge is maintained at a level which allows its use and disposal in compliance with applicable statutes and regulations  4 to protect city personnel who may be affected by wastewater and sludge in the course of their employment and to protect the general public  5 to improve the opportunity to recycle and reclaim wastewater and sludge from the citys wastewater treatment facilities  6 to provide for fees for the equitable distribution of the cost of operation maintenance and improvement of the citys sewer system and wastewater treatment facilities  7 to enable the city to comply with npdes permit conditions sludge use and disposal requirements and any other federal state or local statutes or regulations laws to which the city is subject  8 to establish the responsibilities and duties of the users of the sewer system  and 9 to established the authority of the city to enforce the provisions of this article and to enable the city to assess penalties if these provisions are not met b notwithstanding any other pretreatment provisions to the contrary nothing contained in this article or elsewhere in the citys pretreatment program shall be deemed to be a legally binding commitment under the clean water act 33 usc et seq the missouri clean water law rsmo seq and applicable regulations 40 cfr csr 20 for the city to undertake pretreatment implementation or enforcement activities beyond the minimum requirements of said statutes and regulations nevertheless the city maintains its discretionary authority to undertake pretreatment activities beyond the minimum required by said statutes and regulations  part 1999 prior code  2571   definitions and rules of construction a definitions unless the context specifically indicates otherwise the meaning of terms used in this article shall be as follows act means the federal water pollution control act also known as the clean water act as amended 33 usc 1251 et seq authorized representative of an industrial user 1 if the industrial user is a corporation authorized representative means the president secretary treasurer or a vicepresident of the corporation in charge of a principal business function or any other person who performs policy or decisionmaking functions for the corporation 2 if the industrial user is a partnership or sole proprietorship authorized representative means a general partner or proprietor respectively 3 if the industrial user is a federal state or local governmental facility authorized representative means a director or the highest official appointed or designated to oversee the operation and performance of the activities of the governmental facility or his or her designee 4 the individuals described in paragraphs 1 of this definition may designate another authorized representative if the authorization is submitted in writing to the director and the authorization specifies the individual or position responsible for the overall operation of the facility from which the discharge originates or who has overall responsibility for environmental matters for the industrial user batch means a quantity of wastewater physically separated from all other quantities of wastewater for the purpose of treatment andor discharge biochemical oxygen demand bod means the quantity of oxygen utilized in the biochemical oxidation of matter under standard laboratory conditions in five days at twenty 20 degrees centigrade expressed in milligrams per liter mgl building drain means that part of the lowest horizontal piping of a drainage system which receives the discharge from soil water and other drainage pipes inside the walls of the building and conveys it to the building sewer beginning five feet outside the inner face of the building wall building sewer means the extension from the building drain to the city sewer or other place of disposal categorical pretreatment standard or categorical standard means any regulation containing pollutant discharge limits promulgated by epa in accordance with b and c of the act which apply to a specific category of industrial users and which appear in 40 cfr subchapter n parts 405471 chemical oxygen demand cod means a measure of the oxygenconsuming capacity of inorganic and organic matter present in water or wastewater it is expressed as the amount of oxygen consumed by a chemical oxidant in a specified test it does not differentiate between stable and unstable organic matter and thus does not necessarily correlate with biochemical oxygen demand bod city means the city of north kansas city missouri city sewer means a sewer owned or controlled by the city federal regulations cfr means regulations as issued by the united states government references to sections of cfr shall be in accordance with the latest revisions unless specifically stated otherwise state regulations csr means regulations as issued by the missouri state government references to sections of csr shall be in accordance with the latest revisions unless specifically stated otherwise combined sewer means a sewer receiving both surface runoff and wastewater combined wastestream formula means a method defined in 40 cfr 4036e to derive alternative discharge limits such alternative discharge limits may apply where process effluent regulated by any categorical pretreatment standard is mixed prior to treatment with wastewater other than those generated by the regulated process commercial or industrial wastes means the waterborne wastes from commercial andor industrial establishments as distinct from sanitary wastewater this shall include any discharge to the potw interconnection pursuant to an interjurisdictional agreement commercial user means industrial user composite sample means a sample resulting from the combination of individual wastewater samples taken at selected intervals based on an increment of either flow or time cooling water means the water discharged from any use such as airconditioning cooling or refrigeration or to which the only pollutant added is heat daily maximum means the maximum flow rate or maximum average concentration of a particular pollutant which may be discharged in a day day means a period of normal operation not to exceed twentyfour 24 hours department means the public works department of north kansas city missouri director means the director of the public works department of the city or his or her authorized deputy agent or representative discharge means material directly or indirectly released to the potw  or the act of releasing material directly or indirectly to the potw effluent means the end of process liquid wastes from an industrial process which ultimately are discharged environmental protection agency epa means the united states environmental protection agency garbage means solid food wastes from the preparation cooking and disposing of food together with incidental admixtures and from the handling storage and sale of produce grab sample means a sample which is taken on a onetime basis without regard to the flow rate of the sampled stream and without consideration of time groundwater means water within the earth hazardous waste means any material regardless of amount which would be defined as a hazardous waste under 40 cfr or 10 csr 25 if it were not discharged to the potw industrial user means any person discharging commercial industrial wastes or industrial wastewater industrial wastewater means all watercarried solid liquid or gaseous wastes or a combination thereof resulting from any process of industry manufacturing trade or business or from the development or recovery of any natural resource instantaneous maximum allowable discharge limit means the maximum concentration of a pollutant allowed to be discharged at any item independent of the discharge rate and duration of the discharge rate and duration of the sampling event interference means inhibition or disruption of the potw its treatment processes or operations or its sludge processes use or disposal which results in violation including an increase in the magnitude or duration of a violation of the citys npdes permit or prevents wastewater sludge use or disposal in compliance with any federal state or local law regulation or permit medical waste means isolation wastes infectious agents human blood byproducts pathological wastes sharps body parts fomites etiologic agents contaminated bedding surgical wastes potentially contaminated laboratory wastes and dialysis waste or any other materials or items commonly used or associated with medical care natural outlet means any outlet into a watercourse pond ditch lake or other body of surface or ground water new source means 1 any building structure facility or installation from which there is or may by a discharge or pollutants the construction of which commenced after the publication of proposed pretreatment standards under c of the act which will be applicable to such source if such standards are thereafter promulgated in accordance with that section provided that a the building structure facility or installation is constructed at a site at which no other source is located  or b the building structure facility or installation totally replaces the process or production equipment that causes the discharge of pollutants at an existing sources  or c the production or wastewater generating processes of the building structure facility or installation are substantially independent of an existing sources at the same site in determining whether these are substantially independent factors such as the extent to which the new facility is integrated with the existing plant and the extent to which the new facility is engaged in the same general type of activity as the existing source should be considered 2 construction on a site at which an existing source is located results in a modification rather than a new source if the construction does not create a new building structure facility or installation meeting the criteria of subsection 1b or 1c of this definition but otherwise alters places or adds to existing process or production equipment 3 construction of a new source as defined under this definition has commenced if the owner or operator has a begun or caused to begin as part of a continuous onsite construction program i any placement assembly or installation of facilities or equipment  or ii significant site preparation work including clearing excavation or removal of existing buildings structures or facilities which is necessary for the placement assembly or installation of new source facilities or equipment  or b entered into a binding contractual obligation for the purchase of facilities or equipment which are intended to be used in its operation within a reasonable time options to purchase or contracts which can be terminated or modified without substantial loss and contracts for feasibility engineering or design studies do not constitute a contractual obligation under this paragraph nonresidential contributor means any contributor to or user of the system whose lot parcel of real estate or building is served by a water meter larger than biochemical oxygen demand and which does not contain any of the materials or substances listed in excess of allowable amounts specified in said section npdes permit means the national pollutant discharge elimination system permit issued by the missouri department of natural resources or rpa oil and grease means any material recovered as a substance soluble in an organic extracting solvent as specified by standard method 5520 of standard methods for the examination of water and wastewater 18th edition 199 or the latest revision thereto oil and grease is composed primarily of fatty matter from animal and vegetable sources and from hydrocarbons of petroleum origin the concentration of oil and grease of petroleum hydrocarbon origin can be determined using standard method 5520f the concentration of oil and grease of animal and vegetable origin is defined as the difference between the total and the petroleum hydrocarbon oil and grease concentrations ph means a measure of the acidity or alkalinity of a substance expressed in standard units pass  means a violation of any requirement of the citys npdes permit including an increase in the magnitude or duration of a violation 2586   monitoring facilities a the director may require the owner of any property occupied by an industrial user to install and maintain at his or her own expense suitable monitoring facilities to user  part 1999 prior code  2587 division 3  pretreatment of wastewater   pretreatment of wastewater industrial users are responsible for the content of their discharges and shall provide pretreatment of said discharges as required by this article  part 1999 prior code  2590   pretreatment facilities an industrial user shall provide wastewater pretreatment as required to comply with this article and with all other pretreatment standards and shall achieve compliance within the time limitation specified by epa the state or the director whichever is more stringent any facilities required to pretreat wastewater to achieve compliance with a pretreatment standard shall be provided operated and maintained at the industrial users expense detailed plans showing the pretreatment facilities and operating procedures shall be submitted to the director for review the review of such plans and operating procedures shall in no way relieve the industrial user from responsibility for modifying the facility as necessary to produce a discharge which complies with applicable pretreatment standards  part 1999 prior code  2591   additional pretreatment measures a whenever deemed necessary the director may require an industrial user to restrict its discharge during peak flow periods to discharge certain wastewaters only into specific sewers to relocate andor consolidate points of discharge to separate sanitary wastewater from industrial wastestreams and to perform and maintain such other conditions as may be necessary to protect the potw and determine the industrial users compliance with the requirements of this article b when deemed necessary to protect the potw worker health and safety or otherwise prevent interference or pass the director may require an industrial user to maintain at its facility and at its expense a suitable storage and flow control facility to ensure equalization of flow over a twentyfour 24 hour period such facility shall have a capacity for at least one hundred fifty 150 percent of the daily discharge volume and shall be equipped with alarms and a discharge rate controller the regulation of which shall be specified by the director a wastewater discharge permit may be issued solely to require flow equalization c oil grease and grit interceptors shall be provided when in the opinion of the director they are necessary for the proper handling of wastewater containing excessive amounts of oil and grease or grit  except that such interceptors shall not be required for residential users all interception units shall be of a type and capacity approved by the director and shall be so located as to be easily accessible for cleaning and inspection such interceptors shall be inspected cleaned and repaired regularly as needed by the industrial user at its expense d any person who may discharge wastes which are unusual in composition ie contain an extremely large amount of suspended solids or bod high concentrations of dissolved solids such as sodium chloride calcium chloride or sodium sulfate or contain substances conductive to creating tastes or odors in drinking water supplies or could otherwise cause such waters to be unpalatable even after conventional water purification treatment of wastes which are in any other way unusual shall notify the director who may determine whether such wastes shall be prohibited from or may be admitted to the potw or shall be pretreated before being discharged  part 1999 prior code  2592 division 4  wastewater discharge permits   wastewater discharge permitsgenerally a the industrial user shall apply for and shall obtain a wastewater discharge permit prior to discharging to the potw except as otherwise described in subsection h of this section such applications shall be submitted to the director one hundred twenty 120 days prior to any proposed discharge c any significant industrial user which significantly alters or adds to its operation processes or wastewater volume or character shall apply for and shall obtain a new permit prior to making the alteration such application shall be submitted to the director sixty 60 days prior to any alteration in discharge industrial user due to any increase or change in the industrial users contribution of pollutants to the potw or due to the enactment or revision of this article or promulgation or revision of a categorical standard shall submit a wastewater discharge permit application within one hundred twenty 120 days after the effective date of this article or within one hundred twenty 120 days after the date it becomes a significant industrial user whichever is later e any violation of wastewater discharge permit requirements or conditions shall be a violation of this article compliance with a wastewater discharge permit does not relieve the permittee of responsibility for compliance with this article with all applicable federal and state or local statutes or regulations f no significant industrial user shall 1 discharge anything into the potw without having first obtained a valid wastewater discharge permit  or 2 discharge anything into the potw in excess of or in contravention of the provisions of its wastewater discharge permit  or 3 discharge anything into the potw when its wastewater discharge permit has been suspended revoked or has expired unless the siu has submitted a permit application in a timely manner and the city has failed to issue a new permit than the siu can continue to discharge under their old permit until a new permit is issued g any existing facility which has complied with subsection c of this section shall be exempt from the requirements of subsection f of this section pending the directors decision on the issuance of a permit h upon finding that an industrial user who is not subject to categorical pretreatment standards but otherwise meets the criteria for being a significant industrial user has no reasonable potential for adversely discharge permit conditions to which to objects d the effectiveness of the wastewater discharge permit decision shall not be stayed pending the appeal e if the director fails to act within thirty 30 days a request for reconsideration shall be deemed to be denied  part 1999 prior code  25105   wastewater discharge permit modification a the director may modify a wastewater discharge permit for good schedule and related reports any compliance schedule required by contain progress increments in the form of dates for the commencement and completion of major events leading to the construction and operation of additional pretreatment required for the industrial user to meet the applicable pretreatment standards such events may include hiring an engineer completing preliminary and final plans executing contracts for major components commencing and completing construction beginning and conducting routine operation no such progress increment shall exceed nine months the industrial user shall submit a progress report to the director no later than fourteen 14 days following each date in the compliance schedule and the final date of compliance including as a minimum whether or not it complied with the increment of progress the reason for any delay and if appropriate the steps being taken by the industrial user to return to the established schedule in no event shall more than nine months elapse between such progress reports to director  part 1999 prior code  25113   report on compliance with categorical pretreatment standard deadline ninetyday report within ninety 90 days director the significant industrial user shall also report the mass of each regulated pollutant in the discharge andor in the effluent from each regulated process and the production rate of each regulated process this report must be signed and certified in accordance with b all wastewater samples must be collected in accordance with c if a significant industrial user monitors any pollutant more frequently than required by the director the results of this monitoring shall be included in the report  part 1999 prior code  25115   report of changed conditions a each industrial user shall notify the director of any planned significant changes to the industrial users operations or systems which may alter the nature quality or volume of its wastewater at least sixty 60 days before the change the industrial user shall submit such information as may be deemed necessary by the director to evaluate the changed condition including a wastewater discharge permit application b the director shall respond to said notice within sixty 60 days the director may issue a wastewater discharge permit or modify an existing wastewater discharge permit in response to this notice no industrial user shall implement the planned changed conditions until and unless the director has responded to the industrial users notice c for purposes of this requirement flow increases of more than ten 10 percent or the discharge of any previously unreported pollutant shall be deemed significant changes  part 1999 prior code  25116   reports of potential problems a any industrial user which has an accidental discharge a discharge of a nonroutine episodic nature a noncustomary batch discharge or a slug discharge which may cause potential problems for the potw including a violation of the prohibited discharge standards in this article shall immediately telephone and notify the director of the incident this notification shall include the location of discharge source materials involved concentration and volume if known and corrective actions taken by the industrial user b within five days following such discharge the industrial user shall unless waived by the director submit a detailed written report describing the causes of the discharge and the measures to be taken by the industrial user to prevent similar future occurrences such notification shall not relieve the industrial user of any expense loss damage or other liability which may be incurred as a result of damage to the potw natural resources or any other damage to person or property  nor shall such notification relieve the industrial user of any fines civil penalties or other liability which may be imposed by this article c each failure to notify the director of a discharge described in subsection a of this section shall be deemed a separate violation of this article  part 1999 prior code  25117   hazardous waste discharge reporting a all industrial users shall report to the director any discharge into the potw of a substance which if otherwise disposed of would be defined as a hazardous waste under 40 cfr such report must include the name of the hazardous waste as set forth in 40 cfr the epa hazardous waste number and the type of discharge continuous batch or other the report shall also contain the following information to the extent such information is know and readily available to the industrial user an identification of the hazardous constituents contained in the wastes an estimation of the mass and concentration of such constituents in the wastestream discharged during each calendar month of that reporting period and an estimation of the mass of such constituents in the wastestream expected to be discharged during the following twelve 12 calendar months b such hazardous waste discharge report shall be made a part of every periodic compliance report for significant industrial users and shall be submitted every six months for all other industrial users the reporting requirements in this section do not apply to individual pollutants already reported under the selfmonitoring requirements of a wastewater discharge permit issued pursuant to this article in the case of any report required by this section the industrial user shall certify that it has a program in place to reduce the volume and toxicity of hazardous wastes generated to the degree it has determined to be economically practical  part 1999 prior code  25118   reporting and repeat sampling requirements in case of a violation if sampling performed by an industrial user indicates a
