thereto  3242009   when platting required no portion of an existing parcel may be sold or transferred to another party without first legally subdividing the property according to this ordinance  3242009   statement of purpose the purpose of this title is to provide for the orderly arrangement of land intended for subdividing specifically the subdivision of land shall provide for a the orderly growth and development of the city logical pattern of lots blocks that are appropriately sized and shaped for the range of uses for which they are zoned before such land is made available for sale b an efficient pattern of streets which provide safe and convenient access to each lot and reasonable connections beyond the boundaries of the subdivision c appropriate easements d the implementation of the master plan zoning ordinance and other associated regulations e the creation of an accurate public record of lot tract and easement boundaries and f the protection of the health safety and welfare of the general public  3242009   exceptions when topography property configuration or other issues justify deviation from one or more of the standards set out in this title and when such deviations are consistent with the statement of purpose of this title and will not impair the ability to achieve these purposes on property in the vicinity the planning commission along with city council may at their sole discretion grant an exception to that requirement the reasons for the exception shall be clearly set out by resolution of the planning commission and by resolution or ordinance of the city council  3242009   violation and penalty in addition to any other remedy allowed by law the city may impose the following penalties for violation of this ordinance a no owner or agent of the owner of any land located within the corporate limits of north kansas city knowingly or with intent to defraud may transfer sell agree to sell or negotiate to sell land by reference to or by other use of a plat of any purported subdivision of the land before the plat has been approved by the city council and recorded in the records of the clay county recorder of deeds unless the owner or agent shall disclose in writing that such plat has not been approved by the city council and that the sale is contingent upon the approval of such plat by the city council b any person violating the provisions of the ordinance codified in this chapter shall forfeit and pay to the city a penalty not to exceed three hundred dollars $30000 for each lot transferred or sold or agreed or negotiated to be sold  and the description by metes and bounds in the instrument of transfer or other document used in the process of selling or transferring shall not exempt the transaction from this penalty the city may enjoin or vacate the transfer or sale or agreement by legal actions and may recover the penalty in such action c any person committing any other violation of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction is subject to a fine of not more than five hundred dollars $50000 per day or confinement of not more than ninety 90 days or both fine and confinement  3242009 definitions definitions the following words or phrases when used in this title shall have the meaning ascribed to them in this section except where the context indicates a different meaning where a word or term is not defined herein and does not have meaning readily ascertainable in common usage the zoning administrator may reference the most recent version of harvey s moskowitz and carl g lindbloom the new illustrated book of development definitions center for urban policy research rutgers the state university of new jersey alley means a minor way dedicated to public use which is used primarily for vehicular access to the back or side of properties otherwise abutting on a street block means a piece or parcel of land surrounded by public highways streets streams railroad rightsofway parks etc or a combination thereof certified survey map means a map of lot lines based upon a survey prepared and certified by a registered surveyor of the state of missouri chief building official means the individual staff member designated by the city council as the chief building official or hisher designee city means the city of north kansas city missouri commission or planning commission means the city planning and zoning commission council means the city council and the city of north kansas city missouri culdesac means a street having one end open to traffic and being terminated by a vehicle turnaround easement means a grant by the property owner to the public a corporation or persons of the use of a described strip or area of land for specific purposes including utility lines drainageways walkways director means the director of the department of public works of north kansas city or his or her duly authorized representative improvements means street pavement curbs sanitary and storm sewers permanent street markers sidewalks water mains or other appropriate items lot means a designated unit of land established by a plat or otherwise as permitted by law and to be separately owned used developed or built upon lot line adjustment means the application which by certified survey map revises one or more lot lines of previously platted lots resulting in a change in area shape or legal boundaries to no more than four lots a lot line adjustment is a type of minor subdivision that must also satisfy all conditions of a minor subdivision master or comprehensive plan means the comprehensive plan made and adopted by the city indicating the general locations recommended for major thoroughfares streets parks public buildings zoning districts and other elements including special studies supplemental thereto minor plat means the application which results in division of a lot or parcel of land into no more than five new legal lots a minor plat is a type of minor subdivision that must also satisfy all conditions of a minor subdivision minor subdivision means a platting process whereby legal lots can be established by an expedited review process as provided in this chapter parcel means a contiguous unit of land owned and recorded as the property of the same persons or controlled by a single entity parcel remnant or remnant parcel means that portion of an existing parcel that is not made a part of a subdivision pedestrian way means a rightofway dedicated or otherwise assigned to public use which cuts across a block to facilitate pedestrian access to adjacent streets and properties setback lines or building lines means a line on a plat generally parallel to the street rightofway indicating the limit beyond which buildings or structures may not be erected survey plat means the application which by the certified survey map formally establishes the exact lot lines for any future lots noted on an approved final plat but the approval of which is subject to actual physical construction and development on the proposed lot a survey plat is a type of minor subdivision plat final final plat means a complete and exact subdivision drawing prepared for official recording as required by statute to define property boundaries easements streets and other improvements and dedication of property for public use where required plat preliminary preliminary plat means a preliminary plat for a subdivision shall be a plan drawn to scale indicating prominent existing features of a tract and its surroundings and the general street and lot layout of the proposed subdivision and its relationship to the surrounding area rightofway means the land opened reserved or dedicated for a street highway walk drainage or other public purpose street public public street means a strip of land including the entire rightofway intended primarily as a means of vehicular and pedestrian travel which may also be used to provide space for sewers public utilities trees and sidewalks and which is dedicated or deeded to the public for the above uses street major or thoroughfare major or thoroughfare street means a street or road of considerable continuity which serves or is intended to serve as the principal vehicular way between separated areas or districts street collector collector street means a street which in addition to serving abutting properties intercepts minor streets connects with community facilities and carries neighborhood traffic to the major street system street commercial commercial street means a street used to provide access to abutting commercial properties street residential residential street means a street used primarily to provide access to abutting residential properties subdivider means a person firm or corporation undertaking the subdividing or the resubdividing of a lot tract or parcel of land into two or more lots or other divisions of land for the purpose of transfer of ownership or development whether immediate or future including all changes in street or lot lines subdivision means a division of a lot tract or parcel of land into two or more lots or other tracts of land for the purpose of transfers of ownership or development whether immediate or future including all changes in street or lot lines tract means a unit of land designated for limited or no development as part of a subdivision plat with a legitimate public purpose and designated for public or common ownership zoning administrator means the individual staff member directed by the city council to administer the zoning ordinance or hisher designee  3242009 platting procedure filing fees and additional costs a filing fees 1 the following schedule of fees is adopted which fees are to be paid to the city by all persons or corporations submitting plats for approval by the city and shall be computed to the nearest dollar the fee for any preliminary or final plat application submitted shall be one hundred dollars $10000 plus number of lots in subdivision per lot 10 or less $600 11 to 50 $300 51 or more $100 2 the minimum total fee for any preliminary or final plat shall be one hundred twentyfive dollars $12500 this fee shall be paid at the time that any preliminary or final plat is submitted if the final plat is submitted in segments then the above fee schedule shall apply to each submittal 3 the filing fee for a survey plat shall be twentyfive dollars $2500 b additional costs 1 published notice applicants shall reimburse the city for the cost of publishing public notice for required public hearings reimbursement is required prior to the recording of the final plat by the city 2 recording costs applicants shall pay to the city a sum of money equal to the cost of recording the ordinance and the plat which are based upon the fees set by the clay county recorder of deeds such payment may be made after the council approves the plat but is due before the city submits the plat and ordinance for recording  3242009   preapplication conference prior to the submittal of any subdivision application materials the subdivider shall meet with the director of public works zoning administrator and chief building official so as to acquaint the city with the proposed plat the conference shall determine which approval process the standard or abbreviated platting process under which the proposed subdivision would be able to be considered in addition the city will consider what if any infrastructure and utility improvements may be required in order to adequately serve the proposed subdivision upon completion of the conference the subdivider may proceed with the appropriate subdivision application as determined by the conference platting process selection table  less than or equal to 5 lots greater than 5 lots no new streets nor change in layout of existing streets abbreviated process standard process new streets or change in layout of existing streets standard process standard process  3242009   standard platting process the standard platting process requires the preparation of a preliminary plat to go before the planning commission at a duly advertised public hearing the preparation of a preliminary plat is required when there are more than five lots to be created with the subdivision andor when there are additions to or changes in the layout of city streets or when new streets are to be dedicated a preliminary plat 1 purpose the purpose of the preliminary plat is to determine whether the proposed subdivision will comply with the comprehensive plan development policies of the city and meet the design standards herein contained and other applicable laws 2 submission the subdivider or his or her duly authorized agent shall at least thirty 30 days prior to the regularly scheduled planning commission meeting file such preliminary plat application and associated materials according to procedures specified in the preliminary plat application the time of filing of a preliminary plat shall be construed to be the time at which the same together with required data is received in the office of the zoning administrator who shall indicate the date of submission upon the application and shall schedule a date on which the plat shall be considered by the commission 3 review a staff review within five working days of the filing of the preliminary plat the zoning administrator shall transmit copies of the plat to all involved city departments any findings and recommendations from city departments will be forwarded to the planning commission along with the preliminary plat b planning commission review the planning commission shall approve conditionally approve or disapprove the preliminary plat at a public hearing to be held not later than sixty 60 days after the preliminary plat is received and acknowledged as herein set forth c approval in the event of planning commission approval of the preliminary plat the subdivider may proceed with the preparation and submittal of the final plat as required under these regulations d disapproval in case of disapproval by the planning commission of the preliminary plat a statement in writing of the reasons for such disapproval shall be made to the subdivider one or more subsequent hearings before the commission may be scheduled upon receipt of an amended preliminary plat which meets all applicable requirements any action by the planning commission may be taken to the city council on appeal e duration of approval approval of the preliminary plat by the commission expires at the end of one year unless a final plat covering all or a portion thereof has been submitted and the preliminary plat shall be declared void one year after the date of original approval f effect of approval approval of the preliminary plat does not constitute acceptance of the subdivision but is merely an authorization to proceed towards the preparation of the final plat for record i no grading of streets or construction shall be done on the subdivision before the final plat is approved except by special permission of the city council ii no site grading or site clearance may take place before final infrastructure plans are approved without the express permission of the city council who may grant such permission at their sole discretion a separate site grading andor site clearance plan must be approved by the director andthe chief building official in order to receive the permit such plans shall be compliance with all appropriate sediment and erosion control standards including but not limited to the specifications set forth in apwa  form the subdivider shall cause the preliminary plat of the land proposed to be subdivided to be prepared by a registered land surveyor or professional engineer such preliminary plat shall be in full compliance with the requirements of these regulations 5 information required the following information shall be shown on the preliminary plat a the name of the proposed subdivision which shall be different from that of any existing subdivision previously recorded in clay county missouri and the names of adjacent subdivisions and the owners of record of all adjacent unplatted land  b the name address and telephone number of the record owner or owners subdivider and the person or firm preparing the preliminary plat  c the location of boundary lines of the subdivision and their relation to established section lines or fractional section lines  d a legal description of the land contained within the proposed subdivision including gross acreage involved  e the date of preparation and north point  f the scale of the map shall be no less than one inch to one hundred 100 feet and shall be clearly and legibly drafted and reproduced  g zoning on and adjacent to the tract  h topography of the tract shall be shown on the preliminary plat by means of contours of one or twofoot intervals if the predominant ground slope within the tract is between level and ten 10 percent grade and fivefoot intervals for predominant ground slopes within the tract over ten 10 percent grade all at city datum  i the general alignment and pattern of all proposed streets alleys lots approximate dimensions and other features or areas of the proposed subdivision  j the location of all lot lines property lines streets highways or easements on adjacent property to a distance of two hundred 200 feet from all boundaries of the subdivision or to a greater distance if the planning commission deems it necessary for adequate review and coordination with existing conditions center line profiles of proposed streets may be required by the director of public works in locations where extremely level or very steep natural slopes prevail  k approximate gradients of streets  l the outline of any existing buildings to remain on the property and their locations in relation to existing or proposed street and lot lines or any other feature of importance to lot and street layout  m notation of proposed use or uses of the property as well as any proposed zoning change  and n other preliminary information as may be required by the city in order to assure that the subdivision is capable of being constructed without an adverse effect upon the surrounding area or the community at large b preliminary infrastructure plans prior to the submittal of a final plat the subdivider must provide preliminary infrastructure plans if such was determined by the director to be required 1 submission a determination of need for infrastructure improvements the subdivider shall consult with the director of public works at the preapplication conference or other opportunities to determine the infrastructure facilities necessary to serve the subdivision the subdivider must provide sufficient information to the director so the director may determine whether or not existing infrastructure is sufficient to serve the requirements of the subdivision or whether improvements are necessary to any facilities if the director determines that existing facilities are sufficient no further information need be provided b preliminary plan standards if any new facilities or improvements to existing facilities are needed the subdivider shall prepare and submit to the director any or all of the following as may apply to the proposed subdivision according to the latest edition of apwa standards for the kansas city region preliminary plans and profiles of public streets sanitary sewers preliminary storm water plans and a preliminary water supply and distribution plan 2 upsizing wherever any portion of the required infrastructure improvements are part of a planned future city improvement the city may require that the applicant enter into an agreement to build the facility to its planned size or capacity the city and the applicant shall negotiate an agreement to share the cost of the additional construction with the applicant responsible for all costs that would otherwise be paid in building the facility to serve the specific application absent any upsizing and with the city responsible for any actual costs due to incremental upsizing of the facility c utility review upon approval of the preliminary plat or before approval of any final plat at minimum utility easements will be shown on the final plat according to the design standards of this title at the citys discretion the city may elect to transmit copies of the proposed final plat with proposed utility easements to any or all involved utilities for their review and comment each of the agencies may within fifteen 15 days after receipt of the plat forward to the city any written comments the city may upon receipt of a request from a utility company allow reasonable additional time for review if no reply is received within said period of time such plat shall be deemed acceptable to the utility d final plat 1 purpose the purpose of the final plat is to create an accurate public record for the sale of lots and to ensure all lots are buildable lots prior to recording 2 submission after approval of the preliminary plat and preliminary infrastructure plans the subdivider or his or her duly authorized agent shall at least fifteen 15 days prior to the regularly scheduled planning commission meeting file such final plat application and associated materials according to procedures specified in the final plat application such plat shall be signed and sealed by a land surveyor registered in missouri in a form suitable for recording according to the clay county recorder of deeds the time of filing of a final plat shall be construed to be the time at which the same together with required data is received in the office of the zoning administrator who shall indicate the date of submission upon the application and shall schedule a date on which the plat shall be considered by the commission 3 review a staff review within five working days of the filing of the final plat the zoning administrator shall transmit copies of the plat to all involved city departments any findings and recommendations from city departments will be forwarded to the planning commission along with the final plat b planning commission review upon receipt of the final plat from the zoning administrator the planning commission shall give due attention to compliance with the preliminary plat any comments or requirements from utilities the public works review report of preliminary infrastructure plans and technical recommendations of the staff and consultants c city council review upon recommendation of approval by the commission the zoning administrator shall submit the final plat to the council for their action the council may approve reject or specify changes or modifications therein which it deems necessary and may make its approval subject to such alterations upon approval by the council by ordinance duly passed such approval shall be endorsed on three paper copies under the hand of the city clerk and the seal of the city d recording the zoning administrator shall record the approved plat within thirty 30 days of approval for any final plat where approval is conditioned upon the fulfillment of a specific act by the subdivider then the approval date for the purpose of this section shall be the date that the condition is fulfilled to the citys satisfaction 4 form the final plat shall be consistent with all submittal requirements of the recorder of deeds of clay county missouri for the recording of plats if more than two sheets are required an index map showing the entire development shall be shown on each sheet 5 information required the final plat shall show and contain the following information a name of subdivision  b location by section township range county and state and including descriptive boundaries of the subdivision based on an accurate traverse giving angular and linear dimensions of third order surveying accuracy all calculations shall be furnished showing bearings and distances of all boundary lines and lot lines and the square foot area of each lot  c location of boundaries shall be shown in reference to existing official monuments including true angles and distances to such reference points or monuments  d location of lots streets public highways alleys parks and other features with accurate dimensions in feet and decimals of feet with the length and radii of arcs of all curves and with all other information necessary to reproduce the plat on the ground dimensions shall be shown from all angle points and points of curve to lot lines  e lot shall be numbered clearly if blocks are to be numbered or lettered these shall be shown clearly in the center of the block  f the exact locations widths and names of all streets to be dedicated  g location and width of all easements to be dedicated and their designated purpose  h boundary lines and description of boundary lines of any areas other than streets and alleys which are to be dedicated or reserved for public use  i building setback lines on front and side streets in residential areas including dimensions  j name and address of developer and surveyor making the plat  k the scale of the plat shall be no less than one inch to one hundred 100 feet and shall include date and north point  and l statement of dedication see appendix a  3242009   abbreviated platting process a intent applicability and eligibility abbreviated platting requirements are intended to provide expedited review and approval of minor adjustments to legal boundaries and title of property for proper recording with the county the standards and procedures in this section are only allowed when 1 the adjustments will not involve changes to the layout of city streets or the dedication of any new street or roads unless previously approved city platting process  2 will not conflict with the master plan  and 3 will not adversely impact any adjacent property or public facility b all processes for infrastructure review construction and guarantees noted as part of the standard platting process remain applicable to this abbreviated platting procedure c types of minor subdivisions the following applications are minor subdivisionssubject to the eligibility requirements listed in paragraph a of this section 1 minor plat the division of a lot or parcel of land into no more than five lots 2 lot line adjustment the movement of lot lines that affects the size and shape of no more than four lots and results in no additional lots 3 survey plat the identification of surveyed lots for individual ownership based upon actual construction of buildings site design and other facilities the survey plat shall be in conformance with an approved plan a recorded final plat and result in no additional units lots or tracts as indicated on the approved plan or plat including a note on the approved final plat indicating the maximum number of future lots to be created by a survey plat d submission requirements 1 minor plat a minor plat shall submit all applicable information contained in d for final plats the planning commission or city council may refer a minor plat back standard platting procedures if it is determined to not meet the eligibility requirements of this section 2 certified survey map an application for a lot line adjustment or survey plat shall be submitted with a certified survey map the certified survey map shall be prepared by a registered surveyor and including a a title indicating that the certified survey map is in reference to an approved and recorded final plat and the name of that plat  b north arrow and scale  c lot lines from the approved final plat for the portion the plat covered by the certified survey map  d new lot lines to be created by the survey map clearly indicating any adjustments to the lot lines on the previously approved final plat  e identification of all new lots not duplicating the name of any existing or previously approved lot identifications  f the exact location of all buildings structures or other physical improvements  g names and exact location of all abutting streets lots and parcels  h exact location and dimension of all existing easements and utility facilities  i a statement by the applicant that the certified survey map is in conformance with all zoning requirements all conditions of previous plan or plat approvals subdivision regulation requirements or other applicable city ordinances  and j a signature block containing the following signatures i signature of the owner or owners including name and address  ii signature of a notary public  and iii certification of the registered land surveyor who prepared the survey map including name and address e review procedure 1 minor plat the review procedure for a minor plat shall be the same as for a final plat except that no preliminary plat procedure is required the planning commission or city council may refer a minor plat back standard platting procedures if it is determined to not meet the eligibility requirements of this section 2 certified survey map the zoning administrator or his or her designee may approve a certified survey map provided that the applicant presents clear and convincing evidence that the certified survey map a is in conformance with requirements of the zoning ordinance and zoning for the subject property  b is in conformance with the subdivision regulations  c is in conformance with all approved plans and plats for the subject property including any proposed future lots indicated on the final plat in the case of a survey plat  d satisfies all conditions on the approved plan and plat  e satisfies all eligibility and approval standards for a minor subdivision  f results in no additional lots than are existing or than are indicated on an approved final plat  and g meets the standards for property boundary surveys as established by the missouri board for architects professional engineers and land surveyors and the missouri department of natural resources  3242009   criteria for review in achieving the purposes of this ordinance in the planning commission and city council shall consider the following criteria when reviewing any preliminary plat final plat or minor plat application a each resulting lot results in a buildable lot capable of meeting all existing zoning ordinance requirements demonstrated by a sketch plan of proposed or possible buildings on the site consideration shall also be given to buildable lots for reasonably anticipated development should the proposed sketch plan not be built b no plat shall result in adjacent properties becoming unbuildable c each resulting lot or tract will conform to the goals strategies and design concepts in the master plan or any official area plan adopted by the city under the master plan regarding the physical layout of blocks lots open spaces or utilities and regarding the design of the public rightofway and other public spaces d the proposed plat places no burdens or impacts on existing public facilities without plans for addressing such impacts which are acceptable to the city e the proposed plat 1 does not create any new zoning nonconformances  2 corrects or does not unnecessarily extend the life of an existing zoning nonconformance  and 3 does not increase the degree of any existing zoning nonconformance that may exist f the size and pattern of ownership for the proposed application meets the following thresholds or demonstrates that by not meeting these thresholds that the proposed plat furthers the goals and strategies of the master plan or any official area plan adopted by the city under the master plan 1 all applications shall conform to the design standards in  where there is no zoning requirement for lot area no lot shall be less than one thousand 1000 square feet 3 where there is no zoning requirement for lot frontage no lot shall have less than twentyfive 25 feet of frontage on a public street 4 irregular or nonrectangular lot patterns should only be justified circumstances and conditions affecting the overall parcel and demonstration that proposed irregular or nonrectangular lot patterns that will not harm longterm viability and marketability of the lot and other lots in the area when considering use reuse or redevelopment of buildings and sites g the proposed plat will result in all lots or tracts being in compliance with all sections of the municipal code or any specific procedures and criteria for relief from compliance under those codes h the planning commission or city council may condition approval of any application based on site or building designs that further these criteria any ongoing conditions may be required to be covenants recorded with approval of the proposed application  3242009   plat approval or disapproval a within sixty 60 days after the submission of a plat to the commission the commission shall recommend approval or disapproval of the plat  otherwise the plat is deemed to have been acted upon by the commission except that the commission with the consent of the applicant for the approval may extend the sixtyday period b the grounds for recommending disapproval of any plat by the commission shall be made a matter of record c a recommendation of approval of a plat by the commission does not constitute or affect an acceptance by the city or public of the dedication to use of any street or other ground shown upon the plat  3242009   fulfillment of conditions prior to recording of final plat upon city council approval of the final plat the subdivider must satisfy as applicable to a given subdivision the following conditions prior to the recording of the plat a dedication of lands if the subdivision intends to have dedicated certain land for streets alleys or other public purposes tax certificates from both the city and county shall be submitted stating that all taxes and encumbrances have been satisfied  b restrictive covenants one copy of any private restrictions affecting the subdivision or any part thereof for future reference by the city shall be submitted  c final infrastructure plans if any new facilities or improvements to existing facilities are required the subdivider shall prepare and submit to the director as applicable final infrastructure plans and profiles of public streets sanitary sewers final storm water plans and a final water supply and distribution plan according to latest edition of apwa standards for the kansas city region d guarantee of infrastructure installation prior to the recording of any plat 1 the subdivider may choose to complete the installation of required infrastructure according to the approved final infrastructure plans or 2 the subdivider must provide surety to the city in the form of a performance bond certified check or letter of credit enforceable by or payable to the city or its agent in a sum equal to the cost of constructing the improvements subject to the approval of the director and city attorney and according to the approved final infrastructure plans e phasing it is understood that for some developments it may be more practicable to be developed in a phased manner provided there is an approved preliminary plat subdividers may proceed with final platting in phases installation of infrastructure and guarantees for such installation may also proceed on the same phased basis as the final plat however the city retains the right to require sufficient plans so as to assure the viability of the infrastructure improvements surety may be provided in an amount equivalent to the infrastructure to be installed for each phase f failure to fulfill conditions if the required conditions have not been fulfilled in order for the city to record a final plat within one year the approval of the final plat is null and void  3242009   infrastructure maintenance bonds upon completion and approval of construction a twoyear maintenance bond shall be required for all streets curbs sidewalks and storm sewers a oneyear maintenance bond shall be required for water and sanitary sewer lines  3242009   building construction after a plat has been duly recorded construction may begin on buildings within the subdivision upon issuance of building permit however no building permit shall be issued for a building within such subdivision until such public infrastructure has been installed or installation guaranteed covering the installation of said improvements in the block upon which said lot fronts  3242009 design standards all lots shall have direct access to public rightofway b all rectangular lots and all other lots so far as practicable shall have the side lines at right angles to the street on which the lot faces or radial to curved street lines and culdesac turnarounds c where there is no zoning requirement for lot frontage no lot shall have less than twentyfive 25 feet of frontage on a public street d for residential subdivisions corner lots shall be at least fifteen 15 feet wider than the average lot in the subdivision the minimum average depth of a lot shall be one hundred ten 110 feet  3242009   undeveloped or limited development tracts remnant parcels are prohibited however the creation of undeveloped or limited development tracts may be made a legitimate part of a subdivision when a such units of land are designated as a tracts to be included as part of the plat with their purpose made a part of the dedication within the plat and b such tracts serve a legitimate public purpose such as open space recreation environmental protection or achieves other regulatory requirements andor c such tracts may be designated for common or public ownership  3242009   building lines building lines shall be shown on all lots and shall provide at least the setback required by the zoning regulations  3242009   blocks a in general intersecting streets which determine block lengths shall be provided at such intervals as to serve cross traffic adequately and to meet existing streets or customary subdivision practices of the surrounding area b for residential subdivisions where no existing plats control the blocks in residential districts shall not exceed one thousand three hundred twenty 1320 feet in length pedestrian ways andor easements block may be required to serve nearby public facilities  3242009   streets and alleys a arrangement of major streets in the subdivision shall conform as nearly as possible to the comprehensive plan as adopted by the city and provision shall be made for the extension of major and secondary thoroughfares except for courts and culdesacs streets normally shall connect with streets already dedicated in adjoining or adjacent subdivisions or provide for future connections to adjoining unsubdivided tracts or shall be reasonable projection of streets in the nearest subdivided tracts b residential streets shall be so planned as to discourage their use by nonlocal traffic and provisions shall be made for adequate traffic circulation c culsdesac may be permitted where topography or other conditions justify their use a turnaround shall be provided at all closed ends with a rightofway radius of not less than fifty 50 feet such culdesac street shall not be longer than five hundred 500 feet d when a tract is subdivided into larger than normal building lots such lots shall be so arranged as to permit the continuous location and opening of future streets and appropriate resubdivision with provision for adequate utility connections for such resubdivision e streets shall be laid out so as to intersect as nearly as possible at right angles except where topography or other conditions justify variations the minimum angle of intersection of streets generally shall be sixty 60 degrees f street intersections shall either be directly across from each other or offset by at least one hundred fifty 150 feet from center line to center line g streets with reverse curves shall have a tangent between curves h a frontage or service street may be required where frontage along a controlled access street or highway is to be subdivided i alleys except in unusual cases alleys or loading courts must be provided in business blocks alleys are not required in residential districts in case of intersecting alleys a cutoff shall be required of at least five feet measured from the point of intersection of the alley lines the resultant connecting lot line to be at least five feet in length j dedication of half streets will not be approved except where such dedication will serve the public interest and the improvement of the entire street is assured timely agreements k for all public ways hereafter dedicated and accepted the minimum rightofway widths for streets alleys or pedestrian ways included in any subdivision shall not be less than the minimum dimensions for each classification as follows and shall be in accordance with the master plan for streets classification row roadway width back to back of curb major streets primarydual roadway 120 feet  228 lanes arterial 80 feet  52 collector 60 to 80 feet  36 to 52 minor streets residential singlefamily 60 feet  36 feet  residential multifamily and other higher density 60 feet  36 feet  commercial 66 feet  42 feet  industrial 66 feet  42 feet  frontage or service streets abutting major street rightofway 40 feet  28 feet  culdesac same as other minor streets above outside curb radius 10 feet less than row radius alleys 20 feet  20 feet  pedestrian ways 6 feet  6 feet  sidewalks 5 feet  5 feet   3242009   sidewalks sidewalks shall be installed on both sides of all streets they shall be located in the platted street and abut the property line sidewalks shall conform to apwa specifications  3242009   utility easements where alleys will not accommodate utilities easements of not less than ten 10 feet shall be provided on each side of rear or side lot lines or where necessary for the proper location or relocation of public utilities if necessary for the extension of water or sewer lines or similar utilities or for surface drainage easements of greater width may be required along lot lines or across lots easements shall connect with any established easements in adjoining property easements for sewer water and gas lines shall be approved by the director of public works  3242009   drainage a grading grading shall be designed so that all surface water shall be conducted to a street storm sewer or to a natural watercourse no watercourse shall be altered so as to divert surface drainage from one watershed to another no obstruction shall be permitted in natural watercourses unless such obstruction meets with the approval of the director of public works the development of areas subject to periodic flooding poor drainage or other unsuitable physical conditions is prohibited unless rendered suitable by satisfactory improvements b impact of proposed streets proposed streets must conform to existing topography as nearly as possible in order that drainage problems may be reduced streets shall wherever possible follow valleys so as to form a collection system for surface water surface drainage across lots or along the side or rear lot lines shall be avoided wherever possible where such drainage on lots is necessary easements shall be 17  zoning chapters general provisions title the ordinance codified in this title 17 shall be known cited and referred to as the north kansas city zoning   part 2002   purpose and intent a this title 17 is adopted for the purpose 1 promoting the public health safety comfort morals convenience and general welfare  2 securing adequate light pure air and safety from fire and other dangers  and 3 conserving the taxable value of land and buildings throughout the city b to these ends the ordinance codified in this title 17 is designed to set up and accomplish certain standards and objectives by 1 dividing the entire city into districts and restricting and regulating therein the location construction reconstruction alteration and use of buildings structures and land whether for residence business manufacturing or other specified uses  2 avoiding or lessening congestion in the public streets  3 preventing the overcrowding of land limiting the height and bulk of buildings hereafter erected as related to land area  4 establishing regulating and limiting the building or setback lines on or along streets alleys or property lines  5 regulating and limiting the intensity of the use of lot area and regulating and determining the area of open spaces within and surrounding such buildings  6 establishing standards to which buildings or structures therein shall conform  7 prohibiting uses buildings or structures incompatible with the character of the residence business or manufacturing districts  8 preventing additions to and alterations or remodeling of existing buildings or structures in such a way as to avoid the restrictions and limitations imposed hereunder  9 providing for the gradual elimination of those uses buildings and structures which are incompatible with the character of the districts in which they are made or located including without being limited thereto a elimination of such uses of unimproved lands or lot areas when existing rights of the persons in possession thereof are terminated or when the uses to which they are devoted are discontinued b elimination of uses to which such buildings and structures are devoted if they are adaptable for permitted uses and c elimination of such buildings and structures when they are destroyed or damaged in major part  10 defining and limiting the powers and duties of the administrative officers and bodies as provided hereinafter  11 prescribing penalties for the violation of the provisions of this title 17 or of any amendment thereto  part 2002   authority the ordinance codified in this title is enacted pursuant to the powers granted and limitations imposed by the constitution and laws of the state of missouri including the statutory authority granted in rsmo as amended  part 2002   applicability and jurisdiction the provisions of this title shall apply to the development of all structures and land within the incorporated area of the city of north kansas city it shall be unlawful to conduct any development or construct any structure until a all applicable development review and approval processes have been followed  b all applicable approvals have been obtained  and c all required permits or authorizations to proceed have been issued  part 2002   interpretation a in their interpretation and application the provisions of this title 17 shall be held to be the minimum requirements for the promotion of the public health safety morals and welfare of the citizens of north kansas city b where the conditions imposed by any provision of this title upon the a use of land or buildings b the bulk of buildings c floor area requirements d lot area requirements and e yard requirements are either more restrictive or less restrictive than comparable conditions imposed by any other provision of this tile or of any other law ordinance resolution rule or regulation of any kind the regulations which are more restrictive or which impose higher standards or requirements shall govern c this title is not intended to abrogate any easement covenant or other private agreement  provided that where the regulations of this title are more restrictive or impose higher standards or requirements than such easements covenants or other private agreements the requirements of this title shall govern d no building structure or use not lawfully existing at the time of the adoption of this title shall become or be made lawful solely by reason of the adoption of this title  and to the extent that and in any manner that such unlawful building structure or use is in conflict with the requirements of this title such building structure or use remains unlawful hereunder  part 2002   rules of construction the language set forth in the text of this title will be interpreted in accordance with the following rules of construction a the singular number includes the plural and the plural the singular  b the present tense includes the past and the future tenses and the future the present  c the word shall is mandatory while the word may is permissive  d the masculine gender includes the feminine and neuter  e all measured distances shall be to the nearest integral foot  if a fraction is onehalf foot or more the integral foot next above shall be taken  f the time within which an act is to be completed shall be computed by excluding the first day and including the last day if the last day is a saturday sunday or legal holiday that day shall be excluded and the act shall be completed on the next business day  part 2002   separability it is declared to be the intention of the city council of the city of north kansas city missouri that the several provisions of the ordinance codified in this title 17 are separable in accordance with the following a if any court of competent jurisdiction shall adjudge any provisions of this title to be invalid such judgment shall not affect any other provision of this title not specifically included in said judgment b if any court of competent jurisdiction shall adjudge invalid the application of any provision of this title to a particular property building or other structure such judgment shall not affect the application of said provision to any other property building or structure not specifically included in said judgment  part 2002   reserved editors note  adopted  repealed   which pertained to accessory building means a subordinate building located on the same lot or portion of a principal building the use of which is incidental to that of the principal building and customary in connection building height means the vertical distance from grade plane to the average height of the highest roof surface for purposes of this definition grade plane is the reference plane representing the average of finished ground level adjoining the building at exterior walls where the finished ground level slopes away from the exterior walls the reference plane shall be established by the lowest points within the area between the building and the lot line or where the lot line is more than six feet from the building and a point six feet from the building building permit means written permission issued by the proper municipal authority for the construction repair alteration or addition to a structure building principal principal building means a nonaccessory building in which is conducted the principal use of the lot on which it is located building residential residential building means a building arranged designed used or intended to be used for a residential occupancy by one or more families building temporary temporary building means any building not designed to be permanently located placed or affixed in the place where it is bulk means a composite characteristic of the time of emission in minutes for the purpose of this calculation a ringelmann density reading is made at least once every minute during the period of observation  each reading is then multiplied by the time in minutes during which it is observed  the various products are then added together to give the total number of smoke units observed during the total period under observation sound level the location and boundaries of the districts established by the ordinance codified in this title are set forth on the zoning district map which is made a part of this title the said map together with everything shown thereon and all amendments thereto shall be as much a part of this title as though fully set forth and described herein the map shall be filed with the office of the city clerk and copies thereof in the office of the building inspector and shall be open to public reference at all times during which those offices are open  part 2002   boundaries of districts when uncertainty exists with respect to the boundaries of the various districts as shown on the zoning district map the following rules shall apply a district boundary lines are either the center lines of railroads or the rightofway lines of highways streets alleys tract or lot lines or such lines extended unless otherwise indicated b in areas not subdivided into lots and blocks wherever a district is indicated as a strip adjacent to and paralleling a street highway or railroad the depth of such strips shall be in accordance with dimensions shown on the maps measured at right angles from the property line of a street highway or railroad and the length of frontage shall be in accordance with dimensions shown on the map from the property lines of streets highways or railroad rightsofway unless otherwise indicated c where a district boundary line divides a lot in single ownership the regulations for either portion of the lot may in the owners discretion extend over the entire lot but not more than twentyfive 25 feet beyond the mapped boundary line of the district  part 2002   customary utility uses  exceptions the following public utility uses are permitted in any district if customarily regulation of uses a building on lot in singlefamily residence districts every single family dwelling hereafter erected or structurally altered shall be located on a lot and there shall not be more than one principal building on one lot except as may be approved in the planned zoning process in any nonresidential district any business must have a building or structure from which to conduct business except as may be otherwise authorized by other procedures within this title b allowable use of land or buildings when a use is not specifically listed as a permitted use or cannot be readily classified the director of community development shall determine the appropriate district or districts where such use shall be allowed based on a comparison of other uses that most closely resemble the use in question the following uses of land or buildings are allowed in the districts indicated on the zoning district map and under the conditions specified in this title 17 1 uses lawfully established on the effective date of this title 2 permitted uses as designated in chapters 1716 inclusive c prohibited use of land or buildings no building or tract of land shall be devoted to any use other than one which is specified as a permitted use accessory use or conditional use in chapters 1716 inclusive however where a building permit for a building or structure has been issued in accordance with law prior to the effective date of this title and where construction has been begun within six months of such effective date and is being diligently prosecuted to completion said building or structure may be completed in accordance with approved plans on the basis of which the building permit was issued  and further may upon completion be occupied under a certificate of occupancy by the use originally designated subject to the provisions of this title d prohibited uses 1 no lot parcel or tract of land shall be used and no building or structure shall be erected altered or remodeled for any of the following uses abattoirs  animal crematories  composting in fertilizer manufacture  dumping reduction or incineration of garbage dead animals offal or refuse  storage curing or tanning of raw hides or skins  refining of petroleum or coal oil  salt works stockyards or slaughter of animals or fowl  asphalt manufacture or refining creosote manufacture or treatment  tar distillation  distillation of bones fat rendering glue manufacture 2 no activities involving the storage utilization or manufacture of materials or products which decompose by detonation shall be permitted except such as are specifically licensed by the city such materials shall include but shall not be confined to all primary explosives such as lead oxide lead styphnate fulminates and tetracene  all high explosives such as tnt rdx hmx petn and picric acid propellants and components thereof such as cellulose nitrate of a nitrogen content of twelve and onehalf 1212 percent or greater black powder boron hydrides hydrazine and its derivatives  pyrotechnics and fireworks such as magnesium powder potassium chlorate and potassium nitrate  blasting explosives such as dynamite and nitroglycerine unstable organic compounds such as acetylides tetrazoles perchloric acid  perchlorates chlorates hyrdrogen peroxide in concentrations greater than thirtyfive 35 percent  and nuclear fuels fissionable materials and products and reactor elements such as uranium 235 and plutonium 239  8252009   11192013 pc publiccivic district   statement of purpose the pc publiccivic focus of significant public investment  2182014   permitted uses in district pc no building structure land or premises shall be used and no building or structure shall be hereafter erected constructed is required except that where a side line of a lot in this district abuts the side line of a lot in a district r1a to c0 inclusive a side yard shall then be provided the same as required in the enhances the character of the district and the community at large when reviewing a plan the planning commission shall determine the compatibility of the proposed development with adjacent buildings uses and neighborhoods the following criteria shall be used to determine if the development is appropriate for the site on which it is proposed a exterior public spaces such as courtyards or plazas are encouraged to enhance pedestrian activity b the dominant materials for new construction or additions within the publiccivic district shall be brick andor stone c buildings shall maintain a pedestrian orientation at the street level buildings shall be located to front toward public streets buildings should not be oriented toward a parking lot d parking lots serving buildings should be located in the rear or on the sides of buildings e building entrances shall be defined and articulated by architectural elements such as lintels pediments pilasters columns overhangs or other elements as appropriate f where sites are located at the termination of a street improvements should be designed so that significant architectural features public art or landscaping features are located at the termination of the street in the review and approval process the design guidelines listed above will be considered as requirements unless an acceptable alternative design can be shown by the applicant to better meet the intent of the guidelines as interpreted by the planning commission  2182014   approval of development before beginning any project requiring a building or land use permit in the pc structural alteration or construction of any structure within the district for any of the uses provided for above a site plan shall be submitted to and approved by the planning commission the site plan shall conform with the standards of the site plan review section  of the zoning chapter in addition to the requirements of the site plan shall also include the following information a location and use of all existing and proposed buildings which are the subject of the application including public areas and open spaces b building elevation drawings and all dimensions of height and floor area building on the same lot h buildings shall avoid long monotonous uninterrupted walls or roof planes building wall offsets including projections and recesses shall be used to add architectural interest and variety i faades visible from the public rightofway shall be architecturally emphasized entrance treatment and details j building entrances shall be defined and articulated by architectural colors and details of the building l buildings shall contain a minimum of two stories upper floors of buildings may be made available for office or accessory residential uses but are not required to be functional m all mechanical equipment shall be thoroughly screened from view from the public rightofway and adjacent properties n buildings shall contain a footprint of no more than twenty thousand overlay district purpose and intent it is the intent of this district to a implement the vision and principles of the burlington corridor study june 2009 and the master plan of the city b coordinate regulations impacting the land use development pattern and transportation system concepts in the study c promote a blend of land uses that strengthen the corridor and its relationship to surrounding areas d anticipate the potential for multiple transportation modes including vehicles pedestrians bicycles and transit throughout the corridor so that no one single mode of transportation thrives at the expense of safe and convenient access of the others e strengthen unifying urban design themes along the burlington corridor f promote efficient site and building design patterns for new construction and existing building rehabilitation g allow flexibility to accommodate varying conditions on the corridor provided it directly advances the vision and principles of the burlington corridor study and promotes the intent and concepts of the regulations and design guidelines  12142010   district boundaries the boundaries of the burlington corridor overlay district shall be all property within the city limits of north kansas city excluding the northgate planned unit development district which meets any of the following a all lots with any portion of property within one hundred fifty 150 feet of the rightofway of burlington b the district shall be further divided into the following three 3 subareas 1 north area shall extend from 32nd avenue on the north to 23rd avenue 2 central area shall extend from 23rd avenue to 16th avenue 3 south area shall extend from 16th avenue to 10th avenue  12142010   permitted prohibited and conditional uses the uses of the the proposed material has an identical physical appearance as the material it intended to simulate including color and texture as perceived from any public spaces surrounding the property  ii if the material presents benefits in addition to cost savings such as reduced maintenance or enhanced durability and performance  iii if the material has a demonstrated track record of successful application and use that will result in equally longlasting and sustainable appeal of the neighborhood as that of the permitted materials  and iv the use of equal or better materials is applied in compliance with materials should use muted or earth tone colors accent and trim materials may use bold or vibrant colors b site design the design of individual sites impacts streetscapes site access and circulation and the function and aesthetics for the entire corridor site designs must account for vehicle traffic in a manner that least disrupts pedestrian activity to and immediately surrounding a building 1 streetscapes a all development should be reviewed in relation to the impact on the longrange street design scenarios in the burlington corridor study refer to the study for the three 3 primary street design scenarios  north area  central area  and south area b individual projects should preserve the potential for these concepts to be done and include site designs that reinforce these concepts with proper building placement and orientation c larger or blockscale projects should implement these concepts on critical segments of the streetscape in association with new development d projects that conflict with these concepts should only be approved on a finding by the city that they will not pursue longterm capital projects for that segment of the street and that incremental implementation series of private projects is not possible 2 curb cuts a curb cuts should be limited on burlington sites that have access by side streets or rear alley systems should use these access points for vehicles b curb cuts on burlington should be consolidated within blocks a single central curb cut that provides access to a shared easement circulation system is preferred c curb cuts on burlington should be as narrow as possible to avoid disruption of the streetscape and pedestrian flow in areas planned for higher pedestrian traffic slower turning movements off burlington are desired and narrower curb cuts should be sued singlelane oneway entry ways with access to more remote portions of the site are preferred over wide access to prominent portions of the site d curb cuts should be designed to provide the least disruption to pedestrian facilities along the corridor and wherever possible the grade and surface shall be maintained over vehicle access points 3 parking location a onstreet parking should be prioritized and permitted to contribute to onsite parking requirements b for any area where a parking management district is established parking requirements should be waived c sites with access to frequent transit service and where the nature of the use of the building is frequented by transit patrons should consider a reduced parking count illustration #18 d urbanscaled development supported by the streetscape concepts the study recognizes that this approach may need to be phased in over time particularly in the north area the easiest way to accomplish this is blockscale master plans where streetscape designs access parking and site design of various owners can be coordinated and where redevelopment of sites can then occur under each landowners individual time frame according to the blockscale master plan the standards and design guidelines support the vision of the burlington corridor study however where sites propose development that deviates from the standards and guidelines it should only be done according to blockscale master plans that support the broader corridor interests beyond the individual site particularly in the north area these plans should advance the following concepts 1 each block shall incorporate additional rightofway or cross access easements that replicate the shared use area of the street design concepts provided in subsections b and c of this section a mobile home may be permitted in the city only in an approved mobile home park by conditional use permit see  b a mobile home may be permitted elsewhere in the city by the city council for the purpose of providing temporary housing following a disaster such as fire windstorm or flood  provided such mobile home is removed from its location within six months of its original placement c one or more mobile homes may be used as a temporary office or other nonresidential structure on the site of a construction project  provided such structure is removed upon completion of the project  2005   part 2002   minimum standards for mobile home parks no mobile home park shall have a site smaller than twenty 20 acres the density for mobile home parks shall be not more than five mobile homes per acre a stands and skirts each mobile home space shall contain a level and stable stand upon which the mobile home will be situated and each home shall be equipped with skirts on all sides such skirts to be of material harmonious to the mobile home structure b streets and drives all public streets within the park shall be improved to city standards for residential streets there shall be at least two street or drive openings into the park providing ingress and egress all private drives shall be not less than twentyfour 24 feet in width having portland cement curbs and be surfaced with at least six inches of compacted stone base with two inches of hot mix bituminous concrete as the surface course or equal as determined by the director of public works c parking at least two parking spaces for each mobile home shall be provided within sixty 60 feet of the mobile home such parking spaces shall be off the public street or private drive and each shall be not less than nine feet by twenty 20 feet in size and shall be surfaced to at least the standard set out above for drives d park and playground space park and playground space shall be provided for occupants of the mobile home park on the basis of three hundred 300 square feet for each space in the park such playground space shall be separate and in addition to the open space required for each mobile home space and shall be equipped and maintained for the use of the residents of the park e open space each mobile home shall be located on the mobile home space so that no part of one mobile home structure including canopies awnings carports and other protrusions is closer than twelve 12 feet to another mobile home or to the edge of the surface of a drive no mobile home shall be located closer than thirty 30 feet to the boundary line of the mobile home park or to a public street each mobile home space shall have not less than two live trees planted and in place at least six feet in height after planting f utilities all liquid waste shall be disposed of sanitary sewer system and treatment facility the plans of which shall be approved by the director of public works prior to construction all solid wastes shall be disposed of by accumulation in tight containers and removed at regular intervals by methods to be approved by the director of public works all power and telephone lines shall be underground and shall be in compliance with standards of the utility corporation involved the site of the park shall be graded so that surface water will not accumulate but will run off in a manner that will not adversely affect the residential character of the park or adjacent property the proposed drainage system shall be approved by the director of public works prior to construction of streets or other portions of the park  part 2002   mobile home park plan approval a construction of a mobile home park within the city shall begin only after a conditional use permit has been granted by the city council in compliance with the zoning ordinance no such permit shall be granted however until a development plan for the proposed mobile homes park has been prepared and submitted by the developer to the planning commission and found satisfactory by the commission and further submitted to the city council and approved by that body such plans shall be accurately drawn at a scale acceptable to the director of community development and shall show the following 1 proposed street and drive pattern  2 proposed mobile homes spaces and their approximate dimensions  3 any existing streets in or abutting the property  4 location and size of parking spaces  5 location and size of park and playground area  6 screening and landscaping  7 legal description of the tract  8 name of the landowner developer and the firm preparing the plan  9 north point scale and date b the planning commission shall upon submission of three copies of the plan and an application for a conditional use permit publish notice and hold a hearing on the proposal in conformance with the zoning ordinance the decision of the commission to recommend approval or denial of the proposed mobile homes park shall be based upon the following criteria 1 the proposed property will be in harmony in general with the comprehensive plan of the city  2 two or more routes of safe and efficient ingress and egress of vehicular and pedestrian traffic and an adequate level of utility and other services are assured  3 a safe and healthful living environment will exist for the occupants of the park  4 the plans for the park indicate that neighboring property will not be adversely affected to an unreasonable extent c upon hearing and consideration of the project the commission shall within reasonable time submit its recommendation and an endorsed copy of the plans to the city council for final action d all final plans including detailed landscaping plans and signs to be allowed shall be reviewed by the planning commission and be approved by that body prior to the beginning of grading or other construction of the mobile homes park  part 2002  11192013   mobile home subdivisions prohibited a subdivision for the purpose of selling individual lots in fee for the purpose of mobile home sites shall not be permitted  part 2002   management of mobile home park each mobile home park shall be operated in a sanitary orderly and efficient manner and shall maintain a neat appearance at all times no damaged or deteriorated mobile home shall be permitted to remain  and suitable and effective rules for regulating the outside storage of equipment the removal of wheels and installation of skirtings the collection of trash and garbage and the attachment of appurtenances to the mobile homes shall be continually enforced a map shall be placed at the main entrance to the park clearly showing the location of each space and the name and address of the occupant such map shall be illuminated at all times and be enclosed in a weatherproof case within full view of persons entering the park all drives playground areas and equipment lawn and trees and any recreation or accessory buildings shall be maintained at a level at least equal to the average residential neighborhood in the city all portions of the mobile home park shall be open and accessible to fire police and other emergency and protective vehicles and personnel including city county and state inspectors  part 2002   violation the owner andor operator of the mobile homes park shall be responsible for the conformance to all plans codes and ordinances and any conditions set out in the conditional use permit and any deviation or nonperformance or the occurrence of any nuisance or unsanitary condition or the termination of a park operation for one year or more shall constitute grounds for the cancellation of a conditional use permit in addition the city shall have all remedial and corrective powers conveyed by city ordinances and statutes of the state of missouri  part 2002 planned unit development purposes the planned unit development pud provides for project variety and diversity in any zoning district process established in this chapter development flexibility is provided in exchange for ongoing community benefits that achieve the following purposes a to encourage a mix of different land uses which results in 1 commercial office recreational and educational facilities conveniently located to residential uses  2 economic benefits to the public due to efficient use of land and of public and private services  3 lessen the burden of traffic on streets roads and highways  4 commercial institutional and employment based land uses accessible to residential land uses by multiple modes of transportation including walking biking transit or automobiles  or 5 increased public open spaces in higher density residential and mixeduse settings b to encourage innovations in residential commercial recreational and industrial development and redevelopment which 1 results in better management of or reduction in the environmental impacts of development on the surrounding community  or 2 relates the type design and layout of residential commercial recreational and industrial development to the particular site thereby encouraging preservation of important natural and environmental characteristics of the site c to allow flexibility in the application of the zoning requirements regarding bulk setbacks lot sizes and open space due to unique physical conditions of a particular site while ensuring that such flexibility will not be used in a manner that distorts the objectives of these regulations minimum district size a site proposed for a planned unit development shall contain a contiguous area of five acres or more unless the planning commission and city council find that a smaller district separated only by a road easement or rightofway b additions additions to existing planned unit developments shall have no minimum size provided that 1 the addition is contiguous with the original planned unit development  2 the addition can be fully integrated in function operation and aesthetics into the original planned unit development  and 3 the addition is subject to all approval standards of the original planned unit development  part 2002   establishment of allowed and conditional uses a allowed uses any use specifically authorized in a zoning district may become part of a
